short_summary: Challenge-based solicitation (CBS) for mentoring application solution
description: The Department of Justice Canada (JUS) is seeking a contractor to develop, manage, and maintain an application to support the National Mentoring Program. The proposed solution should be hosted externally by the contractor on a SSC certified SaaS/PaaS.
full_summary:
**Solicitation Name**
Challenge-Based Solicitation for Mentoring Application Solution

**English Reference**
JUS-MENTORING-APP

**French Reference**
SPD-Application de mentorat

**Contracting Entity**
Department of Justice Canada, 284 Wellington Street, Ottawa, Ontario K1A0H8

**Publication Date**
November 22, 2022

**Closing Date**
January 10, 2023, 14:00 EST

**Amendment Number**
1

**Solicitation Category**
Competition - Open Bidding

**Notice Type**
Request for Proposal

**Industry Code**
D301BB0 - Cloud Technology

**GDC PUB-320**
This solicitation seeks a contractor to develop, test, and implement an application to support the department's national mentoring program. The proposed solution must be hosted externally on a Secure SaaS/PaaS compliant server. The application will replace an existing system that is no longer viable.

**Security Requirements**
The security requirements will be identified during the solicitation process.

**Trade Agreements**
This requirement is subject to the following trade agreements: CFTA, Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, CPTPP, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, CETA, Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement, and WTO-GPA.

**Evaluation Criteria**
The evaluation will assess the proposed solutions against the requirements outlined in Section 1 of the solicitation document. The evaluation criteria will include:

* Compliance with the security requirements
* Meets the needs of the department
* Financial and technical feasibility
* Innovation and value for money

**Evaluation Method**
The evaluation will be conducted in two stages:

* Invitation to Refine (ItR) Sessions 1 to 3
* Final Challenge-Based Solicitation

**Contact Information**
For more information, please contact:

* Jeff Williams, Email: Jeff.Williams@justice.gc.ca
* Phone: 236-335-2084

**Attachments**
Please refer to the solicitation document for a list of attachments. [1]

**Language**
Proposals must be submitted in one of the official languages of Canada.

**Negotiations**
The department reserves the right to negotiate with bidders.

**Current Contract**
Not applicable. [2]

[1] - This includes the attachments referred to in the solicitation document.

[2] - No
